node.title: Rare "cotton candy lobster" caught in Maine
node.description: The lobsterman who caught the crustacean named it Haddie, after his granddaughter.
node.content: ["A lobsterman made the catch of a lifetime off the coast of Maine last weekend. Bill Coppersmith trapped a 1-in-100 million iridescent lobster, also known as a \"cotton candy\" lobster, CBS Boston reports.", "Coppersmith has been fishing for 40 years but has never had a catch like the one he made in Casco Bay. He named it Haddie, after his granddaughter.", "Haddie will not end up on a plate \u2014 right now the crustacean is hanging in a tank at Get Maine Lobster in Portland until a permanent home at an aquarium can be found.", "The color change is the result of a rare genetic mutation that is not considered helpful to the lobster because they aren't able to blend in with their environment.", "There have been some other stunning catches in New England waters this year. A Boston seafood company caught a\u00a0similarly rare\u00a0albino lobster off the Maine coast in February. And in July, a fisherman in Gloucester, Massachusetts, pulled an unusual\u00a0blue lobster\u00a0out of the ocean.", "This story first appeared on CBS Boston.", "For Breaking News & Analysis Download the Free CBS News app"]
